body: • Because of an editing error, an article (Labour and Plaid Cymru stalemate over choice to lead Welsh assembly, 12 May, page 4) said that the Tories and Ukip had taken seats from Labour in “the recent local elections”. We meant the Welsh assembly elections, not local (council) elections. The only change from Labour’s 2011 seat tally was due to the loss of one constituency seat to Plaid Cymru. In the regional lists, Ukip won seven seats at the expense of the Conservatives and Lib Dems. • An interview with Geri Horner said the former Spice Girl had “just finished reading A Little Life by Hanya Yanagihara, the novel that won the 2015 Man Booker”. The novel was only shortlisted for the prize, which went to Marlon James for A Brief History of Seven Killings (‘I like myself a bit better now’, 16 May, page 12, G2). • An article about movie roles for black women referred to “Todd Haynes’s All That Heaven Allows”. The writer meant to refer to Haynes’s film Far from Heaven. It was inspired by Douglas Sirk’s 1955 film All That Heaven Allows (In full colour, 13 May, page 14, G2). • Other recently corrected articles include: Israel: ‘Some NGOs are seen as the enemy from the inside’
